name: Douglas G. Howe
content: Douglas Howe - School of Computer Science Skip to Main Content Home / PeopleDouglas HoweProfessor Douglas HoweProfessor Degrees:Ph.D. Cornell (1988), M.S., B.A. CarletonEmail:Douglas.Howe@carleton.caOffice:HP5125DWebsite:http://www.scs.carleton.ca/~howe/Research Interests Automated Reasoning, Formal Methods in Software Engineering, Programming Languages, and Software Engineering Biography Dr. Howe received his Ph.D. from Cornell University in 1988. He was a research associate, and faculty member in the Department of Computer Science at Cornell from 1987 to 1992. From 1992 to 1999, Dr. Howe was a Member of Technical Staff at Bell Labs in Murray Hill, New Jersey. He joined the School of Computer Science at Carleton University in January 2000. He has since served as both Associate Director and Director of the School of Computer Science.
